HYCJdMHG6Zijw1mrW1fGNg.text: I usually come here on a Monday because it's 'Kumar night' and boy can that guy do comedy. If you want a comfortable seat to watch the show on Monday, which starts around 1130pm and goes on for about 2 hours, you should come here for dinner and then stay on. The food is good, typically American, complete with burgers and Tex Mex. I like their fajita platter best. Almost any dessert is good too. Everything on the menu is a little bit pricy for a casual diner, but rightfully so since Hard Rock has established its name worldwide and is allowed to charge accordingly. If you're a fan of coconut and rum, their Pina Coladas are a must have. They are unbelievably fresh and one is never enough for me. They have a shop near the entrance selling Hard Rock collectables and sometimes-overpriced memorabilia.

photos.caption: Photo of Hard Rock Cafe - Singapore, Singapore. Love the car up there!

u4lmtlZKU3WxmFjBU8iPXg.text: Food wasn't great and the service wasn't either. We ordered wings to start but they came out last and were soggy. I had a Cobb salad and the chicken was really dry and didn't taste fresh. Hubby ordered a burger with no bun and no cheese, but it came out with cheese anyway and reported that it was "really bad."The saving grace of our experience here was the second act. Thank heavens this review wasn't based on the first act. I think someone called in a favor for act one to play. They definitely didn't meet the Hard Rock Cafe standards of the US. Act two on the other hand was phenomenal. So far he has played some Elton John, Marc Cohn, Fleetwood Mac, Eric Hutchinson and some other top 10s. I'm a fan and if only reviewing the music (at least from act two), this review would have been a 5.Tip: free wifi login is hardrock/hardrock

jZtzGXY3jfN5gYq_UlVtbA.text: Blah, it's very outdated. The sound system is whack. The place is smaller than most other HR's. Staff is friendly and attentive. Free wifi. The end.

NNxa9YekXw-SzX4ALumaKA.text: We waited 15 minutes just for water and couldn't even get straws.Worst hard rock cafe we have ever been to. We were ignored by three different servers and never had anyone introduce themselves to us. I had a plane to catch and waited forever for our bill until I went to walk up to the host stand to ask for a manager when literally a slew of people chased after me thinking I was dining and dashing. The manager waived our meal for us which was decent of her, although I still got the feeling no one in there really gives a crap if you're pleased or not.Their magnets were $25 so I didn't even get a magnet out of it.

kMBVBsgj9jGX4o6hv7Z05A.text: Why Not? This Hard Rock Cafe was only a few blocks down from the Hotel and it was a Friday night at the end of our first week in town. This place has the look, feel, and energy of its namesake, except there are a lot more people and I didn't think that their version of the "classics" were as good. But a good time was had by all and the next day we were back to eating local.

TuurcerCZ3jQ-Nt61iNopQ.text: Another Hard Rock Cafe that wasn't great. Cool theme but it's a little outdated.... the food in Guam was better and it was little pricey too.

ZGKbNRXjQKTOZZKTGbV32Q.text: Ah, the days of underaged drinking. During my younger days, and even now, I had a clear preference for dinner and drinks as opposed to clubbing. Enter Hard Rock Cafe, an adolescent haunt of my JC days. Or nights, to be more accurate. We would down jugs and jugs of potent Long Island Tea, munch on nachos and burgers, and shout above the throbbing music. Good times. When we turned 18, we had our birthday bash there, a little to the dismay of the wait staff who then realized what had been going on. Years on, the interior is still as cramped and garish, music still as loud, nachos still as good, and Long Island Teas more diluted than I remember. The menu remains great - it's hard to pick a bad dish, and servings are generous. The burgers are a good choice, although then again, it is rather hard to get burgers wrong! I'm rather partial to the mushroom & swiss burger myself, and it comes obscenely juicy. Prices as always are on the heftier side, but it can be ameliorated by limiting the alcohol, though you really shouldn't. Stumbling down the stairs of HRC has to be one of my fondest memories yet.

DEKLePkD3OluKTJZlKn-Cw.text: seen much better Hard Rock Cafesbeen there one evening. Nachos were ok, the Burger also, but definitively nothing in particular. There was a nice live band playing, again "just normal". Unfortunately the air conditions let us feel like sitting in a fridge. Service was fair, but again also low end.

mtO1Pox62HbaOx-LWyWCgw.text: Was there last evening on a department gathering, it was really a bad choice . Slow in service , most staffs are not responsive and having the attitude to serve from how we observed through other tables . Ultimately, food was the reason to be there as most of us being 1st time to Hard Rock.... Utterly disappointed on the quality of their food .... Cold tasteless sandwiches and BBQ chicken. Mud pie should be renamed STONE!!!  Wouldn't recommend anyone to patronize this place .

jblOrityo8W4wW7Y_O_6kA.text: Hard Rock Cafe is obviously targeted at the tourists, so expect sky high prices for your regular American diner fare like onion rings and burgers.When I come in a group, we like to order the mega platter - it has everything in the appetizer menu from buffalo wings to onion rings to spring rolls to cheese potatoes and it comes with 3 different dips for you to experiment with. It share 2 - 3 people very satisfyingly!When you buy the mocktail or cocktail, you can pay extra to have it served on the signature HRC mugs/cups and then get to take the mug/cup home as souvenir. Gimmicky and expensive but I guess if you're a tourist, you'd fall for it!The ambience is pretty loud and gets even louder when the house band starts playing after 10pm, not a good place for a quiet date but perfect for pigging out with friends!

fQaayNMEL29MS8Mk3ruKhg.text: Very friendly staff. Hard Rock Rewards honored at this cafe.

sHehAFTEZS-AhqPJFlbQug.text: My buddy and I ordered a giant Nacho plate, yum!! And two burgers. The food was generally very good although don't expect free refills on your coke... lol. Ambiance was really nice as well. The only reason this place gets a 4/5 is because the service in general was slow. We had to waive down the waiters to attend to us etc, but they are quick to bring our the food.Ps the Hard Rock Cafe mercy store is expensive!

C3ZO3SBYDzczTrVUZu1tnw.text: So the staff took our orders and somehow managed to forget us for the next 30mins. After waiting anxiously and seeing two other tables finish their meals and ours never arrived, I called to ask what's happening! That was when they realised the order had been missed out. I'm not sure how this could happen but it was a big letdown for me. I make it a point to visit a hard Rock Cafe in every city I travel to because the quality of the meals and service is quite dependable. I must commend the staff for a quick recovery as they were full of apology and did their best to try to make up for the mistake even offering to put one of the meals on the house. Aside that lapse, the overall experience was positive, the ambience was great, clean and staff were courteous and prompt. The food was also great as usual feel. Sad I can't rate it higher than 3 stars cos of my experience.

23pZyI0j-jM0Pn1A3BSvzA.text: I visit the Hard Rock Cafes in whatever city or country I visit and Singapore is no different. My friend and I were directed to a table and were given menus and a wine and cocktail list as well. I ordered a glass of club soda and my friend ordered ordered a Coke. My friend opted to order two sides-the Mac and cheese and s small salad. I decided to get the classic cheeseburger which I ordered medium well which came with lettuce, tomato and onion and American cheese. The food was delicious and arrived hot and promptly. Our server was attentive and accommodating. The tip is added to the bill so no need to tip again unless you feel your service was outstanding. I would recommend,

jH_LYxplEfi-Ta_khzH1cw.text: Really had a GOOD time at this Hard Rock.  Price was average for a Hard Rock, no more - no less than any other, and it was CONSISTENT with most Singapore restaurants in the area.GREAT selection of menu items to include foods unique to this area.  I REALLY enjoyed the Chili Crab dip with the tortilla chips (SUPERB), and the Burgers are TASTY.  I had the Java Lava which I would RECOMMEND.The atmosphere was FUN, and the service was ABOVE AVERAGE.  They were playing a mix of old school MTV music videos with some modern day selections.Lastly, I thought the merch selection was AWESOME for a smaller Hard Rock, and the prices were VERY REASONABLE.  They had a buy three T's get the 4th free promo.  I was able to outfit the entire family.While I wouldn't say this is a MUST DO, I would say MAKE SOME TIME and POP IN for a look.

photos.caption: Photo of Hard Rock Cafe - Singapore, Singapore
Photo of Hard Rock Cafe - Singapore, Singapore
Photo of Hard Rock Cafe - Singapore, Singapore

ICRjrFD105hqkyGLT4vENw.text: Hard Rock is Hard Rock! I personally always have and always will love the brand and what you get for it. The experience is unique and the food is just great. The burger was absolutely flawless and so were the cocktails. As a frequent Hard Rock Cafe eater I have to say that this wasn't the best overall Hard Rock experience that I've had. The food was perfect but the rest was lacking from their usual standard of quality.My main complaint is that the usual music videos playing on the TVs around the restaurant were all replaced with a repeating video of the engraving of the Hard Rock logo onto to a solid rock. It looks cool the first time you see it but after it played for the 100th time it just gets super repetitive and annoying. As a replacement there was live music. The guy singing was great but the sound was just too loud for me and I couldn't talk to my family anymore which was annoying. However, the songs he sung and the way he sung them was so good that I'll give it a pass.For a restaurant called Hard Rock Cafe there was surprisingly almost no Hard Rock music there at all. The place was also a lot brighter than it usually is. I don't get why the Singapore restaurant is so different from the usual Hard Rock cafes but it was striking. Overall, i was a bit disappointed. The food was amazing though so it wasn't that bad. Just a lot of little things that could have made the whole evening so much better so easily.

rbc7pgjhC2XegPPyraCEWQ.text: Had a blast with my friends! Wait staff were friendly and attentive and the food portions were huge (we aren't very big eaters - 5 girls shared nachos, a burger, & a twisted Mac & cheese). Was extremely pleased with the live band, Tabula (??); they were super accommodating and sang acceded to a lot of requests (just wished the audience could have been more participative... booo lousy crowd....!!) The place is like any other HRC in the world; prices are steep, but the band is worth going for.

TsV7lJGFUtd4lDsG4cGC3A.text: Took my son for a quick bite -- we ordered potato skin appetizer, he ordered hamburger kids meal, I ordered a mixed drink & bacon cheese burger.  My drink arrived promptly.  2 mins later the potato skins & kids meal arrived at the same time. As I write this review -- 35 mins later I've finally asked my burger to go & it arrived bagged to go... Very frustrated - the manager did take 15%off the $100 bill leaving me to pay only $85 for a kids meal, drink & hamburger to go...

VOcXM4Gv85GWmCiuMkwhVg.text: The décor somehow feels less iconic or warm than the London original, perhaps because of fewer illustrious memorabilia. The food is typical American fare - burgers, ribs, steaks, salads, etc (although there is ph bò/Vietnamese beef noodle soup!) - well executed, but nothing extraordinary or gourmet. What's best here are the service staff - super friendly and pro-active.

photos.caption: Photo of Hard Rock Cafe - Singapore, Singapore
Photo of Hard Rock Cafe - Singapore, Singapore
Photo of Hard Rock Cafe - Singapore, Singapore

yB08nPPIkEBGcBNcX62V4w.text: Went here with some fellow colleagues from California.I have been to a few Hard Rock Cafes before, so I've seen some really nice ones, and some which would barely qualify to carry the name.This particular location is not in a high traffic area, so it doesn't get too crowded, which is good because the size of the restaurant is not that large.It does appear to have an upstairs area which was closed.The amount of memorabilia displayed is on the low side, but there are a few interesting items to see. The food, was on par for HRC, even though the selections were limited too.All in all, still a fun experience. And then there's the Hard Rock Shop where I dropped some more cash on a city pin, glasses, and a couple shirts.Love all, serve All.

nAq32DPGhHebOd6UL1ZvSg.text: I don't know why everybody prefers the Sentosa Hard Rock to this one but we had a great time and great food here. The waiters were very nice to us, asked us a couple of times for refills. We ordered a Chicken Sandwich and The Texan. Both meals were delicious. Also their Rock Shop has some great Shirts and other items that it's hard to choose what to buy. All in all I liked this Hard Rock Cafe and I would always choose to go here instead of Sentosa!

photos.caption: Photo of Hard Rock Cafe - Singapore, Singapore. The Texan
Photo of Hard Rock Cafe - Singapore, Singapore. Chicken Sandwich with Fries

QNmVTQKDESD1rBHEgicg2Q.text: If you're in Singapore and just need some Western food then this would be a good spot. Little expensive but that's just Singapore.

c7BuV9CbU1EOXomUuFCUiw.text: Cool place. Especially on a rainy day. Love the vibe here. Hope I can visit it agin one day.

photos.caption: Photo of Hard Rock Cafe - Singapore, Singapore. Cool place. Love the vibe there.

Ivcm5I-pg97nwORQmrTJvg.text: Meh-Why bother writing a review?  Laconic review due to my unsatisfactory dinner:  Two stars for the chocolate milkshake which was good; HOWEVER,  minus ten stars for the wimpy hamburger!  The end.

photos.caption: Photo of Hard Rock Cafe - Singapore, Singapore. The food served here wasn't as good as the food served at the Lahaina, Maui, Hawaii location-Meh~

T6QD88ttchlUW6qbX8vpcA.text: Visited Hard Rock with some colleagues. The food is as expected. There is one thing on the menu that you do not find in UK (suprisingly) is Fish'n chips,. and that is actually really good. Recommend visiting on Sunday's if you like live music.

photos.caption: Photo of Hard Rock Cafe - Singapore, Singapore. The group Plate playing at Hard Rock on Sunday 6.th September
Photo of Hard Rock Cafe - Singapore, Singapore. Starters

gLpz2XL6Ah3nAfPfYRpbCw.text: Not a bad place but nothing wowed me. The place does seem a little outdated. The sound system is starting to sound a little old and I feel like the place could use a fresh coat of paint. The food was good. I ordered a burger and it was pretty big. It was also very messy. I like a good burger with good amounts of toppings. They even have a good serving of bacon on the burger. They had a good selection of local beer. The bar tending staff was very nice and really took care of me. Very friendly. I'm glad I found this place. I have been craving a burger for a while now.

f9JsmUgGFyyVltHF7k7e4g.text: It's about as American as you get - & everything you'd expect from a Hard Rock!  Sadly, as a Texan I was REALLY looking forward to the Miller Lite.  I had one - & apparently that was the last one in the restaurant!   That's the only reason I didn't give it a 5th star - seems like poor planning to me!!

V6yPMlh6sdmpSFwzXGFbSw.text: It feels odd to compare two Hard Rock Café's in the same city, but the Orchard Road HRC pales in comparison to its sibling on Sentosa.We went to the OTHER one a couple of months ago and had a wonderful time - food was great, drinks were delicious, and the music was really awesome and we stayed until 1 am (with our two young kids). It was a great family night out.THIS one, the food was mediocre (much of which was the same items, just  prepared more poorly), one of our drinks was undrinkable, and the overall environment was pretty lame. The one exception was the pulled pork, so take hope from BBQ.Skip this one, go to Sentosa, have a great day out, and then finish up at HRC if you want a retro rock and roll good time.

GIYTSOQhtFx9pFm4RcvRdQ.text: Had an opportunity to visit the Hard Rock Cafe in Singapore. Very clean, attentive staff, and great music. Like all Hard Rock Cafes there is the typical menu and the food was the same as in other cafes. This location had just completed a renovation to their upper Mezzanine level. Overall a great experience. Store had a lot of good selections for souvenirs along with limited additions pins. This year they added for the first time ever Chinese moon pies with a collectors pin. Very delicious. Recommend you stop in if you get the chance. Will be back if I find myself in Singapore again.

jIdUmciqjzS-ytAx_4JOuA.text: Service was good and fast and the waitress give us some Hardrock Singapore buttons.We had burger that we can't even finished, should had split the burger though.This Hardrock has some Singaporean food on the menu :)

IQE9UlyeA5UcmI2FF1zS5g.text: This is an older HRC. Having been to many HRC's around the world, this one felt the oldest. For example, the booths have older 50's Cafeteria Tables and the vinyl seating is extremely worn and ripped with passing coming out. The staff was just "ok". I waited a bit before anyone waited on me. The I had 3 different servers helping. One was better than the other two which just made the serving "ok"The food was excellent. The Satay was very good and the Texan was even better. But you have to expect that this is a HRC and not a gourmet burger joint.

photos.caption: Photo of Hard Rock Cafe - Singapore, Singapore. The Texan!
Photo of Hard Rock Cafe - Singapore, Singapore. Main room sitting by window.
